p:
For a function of intensity α( x 1, … ., x n ) = α( y), the n-dimensional moments of order r are calculated in terms of Riemann integral [ 46] as follows:
(4) \documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{upgreek} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} }{}\begin{equation*} {v}_{r1\dots rn}=\int \dots \int{x}_1^{r1}\dots \dots{x}_n^{rn}\ \alpha (x)\ d{x}_1\dots .d{x}_n \end{equation*}\end{document} where ri + … rn = r, 0 < r < ∞. Then, the central moment will be:
(5) \documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{upgreek} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} }{}\begin{equation*} {\mu}_{r1\dots . rn}=\underset{-\infty }{\overset{\infty }{\int }}\dots \underset{-\infty }{\overset{\infty }{\int }}\dots \dots \Big({x}_n-{\overline{x}}_n\alpha (x)\ d{x}_1\dots d{x}_n \end{equation*}\end{document} where
(6) \documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{upgreek} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} }{}\begin{equation*} \overline{x}=\frac{v_{1\dots 0}}{v_{0\dots 0}},\dots \dots, {\overline{x}}_n=\frac{v_{0\dots 1}}{v_{0\dots 0}} \end{equation*}\end{document}
